channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Robert McNees
item.description: This is probably the best thing I ever posted on Twitter. The memory is pretty dear to me; I'm sharing it here so it still exists somewhere if that place collapses.

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description: Interesting paper on the role of Pvalb interneurons in the BOLD signal: https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2220777120" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://www. class="ellipsis">pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2220777120I think it massively disproves the theory that the BOLD signal originates from PValb cells. Stimulating those cells has the opposite effect from the normal BOLD signal, and has completely different time course. (Thanks to Matt Kircaldie for sharing the paper)

item.title: Doctors Without Borders (MSF)
item.description: Did you know we are more than doctors? Half our staff are non medical. üöö üö∞ üöë We rely on a strong network of professionals to deliver lifesaving medical aid.Each year, thousands of international staff of all nationalities carry out field assignments working with over 50,000 staff hired locally to give lifesaving medical assistance to people who would otherwise be denied access to healthcare, clean water and shelter.Learn More üí™ https://www.msf.org/work-msf" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www. class="">msf.org/work-msf

item.title: StillIRise1963
item.description: I'm really happy for E. Jean Carroll. She did something that's very hard to do in this society. Many of us can empathize with her, and we'll never have our day. I'm very glad she had hers.

item.title: Yohan John ü§ñüß†
item.description: " It is hard to imagine that before Pat‚Äôs research, the PFC was widely considered a ‚Äúsilent‚Äù brain area that neurosurgeons could lesion with impunity (as long as they did not damage Broca‚Äôs area), and the PFC was not thought to be a proper topic for scientific research."https://academic.oup.com/cercor/advance-article/doi/10.1093/cercor/bhad159/7152341" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">https:// class="ellipsis">academic.oup.com/cercor/advance-article/doi/10.1093/cercor/bhad159/7152341https://fediscience.org/tags/Neuroscience" class="mention hashtag" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">#Neuroscience

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description: On odour landscapes:"How many compounds do natural odours typically contain? How often are those compounds shared across stimuli? What are the best statistical strategies for discrimination?""We quantitatively characterize the odour of 64 vertebrate species (mostly mammals), representing 29 families and 13 orders.""Exploring natural odour landscapes: A case study with implications for human-biting insects" by Zung et al. 2023 https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.05.08.539789v1" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">https://www. class="ellipsis">biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.05.08.539789v1https://mathstodon.xyz/tags/neuroscience" class="mention hashtag" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">#neuroscience https://mathstodon.xyz/tags/olfaction" class="mention hashtag" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">#olfaction https://mathstodon.xyz/tags/entomology" class="mention hashtag" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">#entomology https://mathstodon.xyz/tags/mosquitoes" class="mention hashtag" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">#mosquitoes
